chatserver

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • chatserver.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChatServer, java.rmi.Remote

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements ChatServer
    Class level comments go here All override methods, all of which throw remoteexceptions, are intended to be called over RMI from the client code

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Server.Group
      Class containing a set of accounts.
      class  Server.Mailbox
      A ClientCallback that implements message queuing while the client is away.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ClientCallback> accounts
      Hashmap that pairs account names to the corresponding ClientCallback object needed to send messages to that client
      private ChatServer myStub
      Stub that can be exported to allow client to make RMI calls to the server
      private java.rmi.registry.Registry registry
      RMI registry the server is registered to

      • _addAccount

        private void _addAccount(java.lang.String accountName,
                         ClientCallback x)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method to add account or group to the HashMap storing account and group names
        Parameters:
        accountName: - name of account to add
        x: - ClientCallback object corresponding to account name, which provides a reference so server can send messages
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on RMI failure. Check connection to server.
